person.persName: John Young Brown (Hardin County, Kentucky, attorney and politician)

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Hardin County native. Educated at Centre College in Danville, Kentucky. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1857. Practiced law in Elizabethtown, Kentucky, and Louisville, Kentucky. Married twice to Lucy Barbee Brown. Married to Rebecca Dixon Brown. Father of Elizabeth Cabell Brown, Archibald Dixon Brown, John Young Brown, Jr., Virginia Singleton Brown Humphrey, Susan Dixon Brown, and Evelyn Brown Rodman. Served the Fifth Congressional District of Kentucky as a Democratic member of the United States House of Representative from 1860 to 1861, not serving until the second session due to the House age requirement. Served as a member of the Stephen A. Douglas National Committee in 1860. Elected to the Second Congressional District of Kentucky as a Democratic member of the United States House of Representative from 1866, but denied his seat due to a charge of disloyalty during the Civil War.
